701944f-a.title: Bronx: University Avenue - Burnside Avenue
701944f-a.text:
Vhniversity Avenue, west side just south of Birnside Avenue,
showing the entrance to Embrook, according to Mr. Chrystie,
the photographer. Embrook was the home of Mrs. Ludlow Dadwood,
and was later the clubhouse of Berkeley 9val. This estate
was owned by T. C. Eastman, according to an 1868 atlas and
was Berkeley Cval in 1900(Bromley atlas).
E. P. Chrystie  May 30, 1923
CREDIT LINE IMPIRA IVS  Views 1,2
701944f-a.folder: University Avenue & Burnside Avenue, Bronx, NY

701943f-a.title: Bronx: University Avenue - Burnside Avenue (West)
701943f-a.text:
(1)
Universitv Ave. (left, from fore to background), north froc and
including West BurnsideAee.In the foreground is the noFth side of
West Burnside Ave. from University to Harrison Aves. and the old
Croton Aqueduct running between the two and parallel to them.
August 5, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, another view. The two buildings on the left bear
Nos. 2O01 and 2O15. North of that and seen through the trees is
Gould Hall of New York University.
August 5, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
701943f-a.folder: University Avenue & Burnside Avenue (West), Bronx, NY

702065f.title: Bronx: West Burnside Avenue - E. University Avenue.
702065f.text:
W. Burnside Avenue, north side, east fror University Avenue
(foreground) to Harrison Avenue, showing the old Croton Adueduct
at the N.E. corner of University Avenue. The Burnside Manor
Building is at the N.W. corner of Harrison Avenue.
January 30, 1938
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
